results.abstract: Article on Apollo project 6 mos after spacecraft fire; better morale, managerial and tech improvements found; views of Admr Webb, NASA space chief Dr Mueller, Apollo program dir Maj Gen Phillips, N Amer Aviation space div pres W B Bergen cited; space officials still concerned about loss of Cong confidence as result of Cong hearings on fire and shortcomings of project revealed in Phillips rept and Apollo Rev Bd rept

headline.main: Six Months After Tragedy, the Apollo Program Finds Itself Gaining but 'Still in a Time of Testing'

results.snippet: WASHINGTON, July 1--Half a year after the Apollo spacecraft fire--which has cost the nation three lives, six months' lost time and $100-million--the  space program is just emerg  ing from the shock.

headline.main: A New Hotel Makes Debut in Atlanta

results.snippet: ATLANTA, Ga.--This burgeoning Southern  metropolis has gone the pheasant-and/or-baseball-under-glass concept one step further. It has under glass, and all in air-conditioned comfort, a spanking new $18-million-plus hotel that at first glance makes...
results.lead_paragraph: ATLANTA, Ga.--This burgeoning Southern metropolis has gone the pheasant-and/or-baseball-under-glass concept one step further. It has under glass, and all in air-conditioned comfort, a spanking new $18-million-plus hotel that at first glance makes the vistor think that perhaps he is in a modern-day version of the gallerias in Naples or Milan.

headline.main: Oregon Has a Lunar Landscape All Its Own

results.snippet: SISTERS, Ore. Since late last April, scientists  from the National Aeronautics and Space Administration have had a slightly clearer idea of what the surface of the moon is actually like.

results.snippet: Indications are mounting that this 50th anniversary year of the  Bolshevik Revolution will ago into history also as the most productive and richest year in Soviet and Russian history. Western analysts are already studying the implications for...
results.lead_paragraph: Indications are mounting that this 50th anniversary year of the Bolshevik Revolution will ago into history also as the most productive and richest year in Soviet and Russian history. Western analysts are already studying the implications for Moscow's foreign and domestic policy of the unprecendented prosperity it is enjoying this year.
